Definition: Automating backend APIs to validate invoice processing rules, data accuracy, workflows, approvals, blocking logic, and dashboard metrics.
Automation Strategy: API-first approach. Automate critical business rules such as invoice classification, duplicate validation, PO/Non-PO decision logic, approval routing, blocking and release logic. API tests will act as the primary regression suite and will be integrated with CI/CD pipelines.

Definition: Automating critical UI workflows to validate invoice visibility, approvals, dashboards, and reports.
Automation Strategy: UI automation will be limited to high-value scenarios such as approval actions, dashboard rendering, and report access. Avoid duplicating API validations at UI level to reduce maintenance and flakiness.

Definition: Automating validation of data flow between Sprint AP and external systems like SAP, OCR services, and Email systems.
Automation Strategy: Focus on validating request/response contracts, data consistency, and error handling between systems. Automation will cover happy paths; complex exception cases will be manually validated initially.

Definition: Automating previously validated scenarios to ensure new changes do not break existing functionality.
Automation Strategy: Maintain a stable regression suite covering core invoice lifecycle scenarios. Execute regression tests nightly and before major releases.

Definition: Automating a small set of critical test cases to validate build stability.
Automation Strategy: Smoke tests will cover invoice ingestion, basic validation, and posting readiness. Executed on every deployment and CI build.

Definition: Executing automated tests using multiple datasets across countries, invoice types, and scenarios.
Automation Strategy: Use external test data files to validate country-specific rules (USA, Germany, Norway), PO vs Non-PO flows, and duplicate cases without duplicating scripts.

Definition: Automating validation of role-based access and approval authority at API level.
Automation Strategy: Validate that users can access and act only on permitted invoices and approvals. Focus on negative access scenarios and role escalation prevention.

Definition: Automating validation of backend data powering dashboards and reconciliation reports.
Automation Strategy: Validate KPI calculations and report data via APIs rather than UI wherever possible. UI checks will be limited to visual sanity validation.
